title: To what extent does knowledge influence regulations? - Quora

response.answer_text: To what extent does knowledge influence regulations? Knowledge influences regulations as a cover/excuse to install regulations. Regulations are too often the result of someone’s: • power hunger • revenue enhancing • ego validation. Really If there is a four way stop sign and there is nor other car for 10,000 miles around - -AND - - you slow, then proceed through the stop sign, you are still liable to get a summons/fine for transgressing the law. WHY? - JOE FALLICA

Knowledge is defined as :” facts, information, and skills acquired through experience or education; the theoretical or practical understanding of a subject.” and “awareness or familiarity gained by experience of a fact or situation.” Regulations used in government are based on 30% education and 70% bullsh**t. It is always up to the people to make the regulation work. Regulations used for mechanical purpose’s are about 70% efficient by knowledge and the other 30% is unregulated by-products. Regulations used in nature are about 3% knowledge and the other 97% is consciousness potential.
